alert.note: Alert for Camden; Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 12:32PM EDT until June 16 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL SALEM...NORTHWESTERN CAMDEN...CENTRAL GLOUCESTER... SOUTHWESTERN PHILADELPHIA AND SOUTHEASTERN DELAWARE COUNTIES... At 1231 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Ashland to Turnersville to Elmer, moving east at 35 mph. This storm has a history of producing quarter sized hail in northern Delaware. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Camden, Gloucester City, Deptford, West Deptford, Glassboro, Bellmawr, Woodbury, Pitman, Clayton, Folcroft, Paulsboro, Westville, Woodstown, Woodbury Heights, National Park, Swedesboro, Brooklawn, Elmer and Audubon Park. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 2 and 3. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 19. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 348 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 15 and 29. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
